page.title: 11CASTLETOWN DIALECT
page.content: As in most parts of Britain ,dialect words are disappearing. Castletown people have the nickname of 'Oakies'(guillemots),used by the school as its emblem. Some dialect words still in use: peedie-----small loon-------boy oxters-----armpits muckle-----much wifie------woman shochad---lapwing foosum-----dirty couped-----tripped bowg------stomach havers-----foolish piece------snack/sandwich talk lum--------chimney hev--------have howld------hold hirple-----limp stour------dust loog-------ear wir--------our dunt-------bump wirsels---ourselves semmit-----vest cheil------person ticht------ticht kye--------cattle kist-------chest/box moogie-----mug brae-------hill
